Shocking Video Surfaces: Kanpur Man identified as Brajesh Kumar Mishra engaged in disturbing acts with cattle

On Friday, a man was apprehended for allegedly committing acts of sexual assault on stray cattle in the Gujaini area of the city. The accused, identified as Brijesh Kumar Mishra (57), was captured based on a complaint filed by Mayank Tripathi, the district convener of Hindu Jagran Manch. The Hindu Jagran Manch volunteers provided CCTV footage from July 5, which clearly showed the man engaging in sexual acts with bovines in the Gujaini area.

Anand Prakash Tiwari, Joint Police Commissioner, stated, "The Gujaini police have arrested Brijesh Kumar Mishra and have registered a case against him under section 377 (unnatural offences) of the IPC. The accused has been taken into custody for his involvement in unnatural sexual activities with cattle." The police have obtained videos and photos from the CCTV footage, which provide evidence of his misconduct involving various types of animals.

Preliminary investigations suggest that the accused may be suffering from some form of psychological disorder. "His neurological and mental checkups are being conducted. We will take appropriate action in the interest of society," stated Tiwari.
